required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Post-market Clinical Follow up of the Genio™ System for the Treatment of Obstructive Sleep Apnea in Adults
clinical_study.official_title: A Post-market Clinical Follow up of the Genio™ System for the Treatment of Obstructive Sleep Apnea in Adults.

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to confirm the safety and clinical effectiveness of the Genio™ system, used according to its instructions for use, in moderate to severe Obstructive Sleep Apnea (OSA) adult patients over a period of 3 years post-surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of all reported Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) and all procedure- or device-related Adverse Events (AEs)
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of all reported Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) and all procedure- or device-related Adverse Events (AEs) reported during the study

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Apnea-Hypopnea Index from baseline
primary_outcome.description: Change in Apnea-Hypopnea Index (AHI) from baseline as measured by sleep lab

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the quality of life measured by the Functional Outcomes of Sleep Questionnaire
primary_outcome.description: Change in the quality of life measured by the Functional Outcomes of Sleep Questionnaire (FOSQ)

arm_group.description: Following activation of the Genio™ system at 8 weeks post-surgery, patients will be followed at 12 weeks, 6 months, 10 months, 12 months and then every year for a total period of 3 years after surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Body Mass Index (BMI) < 35 kg/m2
- AHI between 15 to 65 events/hour documented by a PSG during the screening phase.
- Has either not tolerated, has failed or refused Positive Airway Pressure (PAP) or Mandibular Advancement Device (MAD) treatments.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Night shift worker
- Significant comorbidities that contraindicates surgery
- Life expectancy < 12 months
- Participation in another clinical study (excluding registries) during the study period (3 years).

facility.name: Klinik für HNO-Heilkunde, Kopf- und Halschirurgie, Schlafmedizinisches Zentrum
